title: About RLJIT

details.vision: To be a premier institution by imparting Quality in Technical Education, Professional Training and Research

text_for_ai: RLJIT envisions being a premier institution by imparting Quality in Technical Education, Professional Training, and Research.

title: About The Trust (Sri Devaraj Urs Educational Trust)

institutes_managed: Sri Devaraj Urs College of Nursing (1986)
R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (2001)
Sri Devaraj Urs International Residential School (2003)

text_for_ai: The Sri Devaraj Urs Educational Trust (SDUET) runs several institutes, including Sri Devaraj Urs Medical College, R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (est. 2001), and others.

title: Hostel Facility

details.structure: Two boys hostels, two girls hostels (six blocks)
details.amenities: Homely food, Solar hot water, RO-purified water, Wi-Fi (32Mbps), LED TV, Gym, Swimming pool, 24/7 Medical vehicle, Power backup

text_for_ai: The Institution provides separate hostels for boys and girls accommodating over 800 students. Facilities include Wi-Fi, gym, swimming pool, nutritious food, and 24/7 medical support.

title: Library and Information Center
text_for_ai: The automated Library and Information Center holds over 25,000 volumes, provides access to 7,700+ e-journals via the VTU Consortium, and includes plagiarism checking tools and Wi-Fi.

title: Department of Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AIML)

details.resources: Faculty profiles and publication details available

text_for_ai: The Department of AIML focuses on AI and Machine Learning education and research, providing access to faculty profiles and publications.

title: TECHNOUTSAV (CSE)

details.organizer: Department of Computer Science and Engineering

text_for_ai: The CSE Department organized TECHNOUTSAV, a technical fest featuring over 10 events like coding and gaming, attended by over 800 students from various colleges.

title: Placement Cell

details.activities: Campus interviews, Technical seminars, Workshops, Corporate expectation sessions, Individual counseling
details.resources: Placement records, MOUs, Placed students lists

text_for_ai: The RLJIT Placement Cell facilitates campus interviews with reputed organizations and prepares students through workshops, seminars, and counseling.

title: Definition of Ragging

details.definition: Teasing, rudeness, rowdy activities, financial extortion, physical or mental abuse
details.scope: Includes bullying based on color, race, religion, caste, ethnicity, or gender

text_for_ai: Ragging is strictly prohibited and defined as any conduct causing annoyance, hardship, or physical/psychological harm, including bullying and extortion.

title: Incubation Center

details.offerings: Mentorship, Office space, Infrastructure, Funding assistance
details.focus_areas: Agriculture, AI, Bio-tech, Cyber Security, Defence, Healthcare, IT
details.startups: Big Line Infotech, Sigma Networks Technology, Forever Frozencomp innovations

text_for_ai: The Incubation Centre fosters entrepreneurship by providing mentorship and resources in fields like AI and Agriculture. It currently supports startups like Big Line Infotech and Sigma Networks.

title: Key Administration & Faculty
text_for_ai: Key faculty include Principal Dr. P. Vijayakarthik and Vice Principal Dr. Shivaprasad. The institute has specialized faculty across CSE, ECE, ME, and Allied Sciences.

title: R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (RLJIT) - Overview

details.location: Kodigehalli, Doddaballapur – 561203, Bengaluru Rural District, Karnataka, India

text_for_ai: R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (RLJIT) was established in 2001 in Doddaballapur, Karnataka. It is affiliated with VTU, approved by AICTE, and managed by the Sri Devaraj Urs Educational Trust.

title: Fee Structure & Courses
text_for_ai: RLJIT offers B.Tech, M.Tech, and MBA programs. The total 4-year fee for CSE is approximately ₹10.45 Lakhs, while Mechanical Engineering is around ₹4.8 Lakhs. The MBA program costs approximately ₹1.37 Lakhs for 2 years.

title: Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)

details.focus_areas: Fundamental learning, project-based education, cutting-edge technologies

text_for_ai: The CSE Department at RLJIT, established in 2001, offers UG, PG, and Ph.D. programs. It features a recognized R&D center and has grown its student intake to 150 as of 2023.

title: CSE Leadership & Faculty

details.hod: Dr. Sunil Kumar R M (Associate Professor)
details.assistant_professors_count: 13+ (including Mr. Anand Reddy G M, Mr. Shankar N B, etc.)

text_for_ai: The CSE department is led by HOD Dr. Sunil Kumar R M and Principal Dr. P. Vijayakarthik. The faculty team includes professors, associate professors, and assistant professors supported by technical staff.

title: Department Events & Activities

details.technical_fest: TECHNOUTSAV (Organized by CMOCS forum, included Coding, Gaming, Tech Talks)
details.workshops: SDP on Full Stack Development, Data Driven Revolution (Accenture AI)
details.awareness_programs: IEEE Awareness Program, World Environment Day

text_for_ai: The department hosts active events such as the TECHNOUTSAV technical fest, Student Development Programs (SDP) on Full Stack Development, and various awareness workshops.

title: B.Tech Admission Eligibility & Process

details.optional_subjects: Chemistry, Bio-Technology, Biology, or Computer Science
details.management_quota: Direct admission available (Must meet 45% academic eligibility)

text_for_ai: Admission to B.Tech requires 10+2 with Physics and Math plus an optional subject, with a minimum of 45% marks (40% for reserved categories). Seats are allotted via KCET, COMEDK, or Management Quota.

title: Campus Infrastructure & Amenities

details.hostel: 2 Boys & 2 Girls hostels (6 blocks), Capacity: 800+ (500 boys, 300 girls), Wi-Fi (32Mbps), Gym, Solar hot water
details.library: 25,917 volumes, 3,254 titles, VTU Consortium member, Digital Library with Knimbus/DELNET
details.medical: On-campus dispensary with qualified professionals and emergency vehicle
details.other_amenities: ATM, Staff Quarters, Co-operative Society, Kalamandir (Cultural Hub), 24/7 Gym

text_for_ai: RLJIT provides hostels for over 800 students, a library with over 25,000 volumes, transport, an on-campus dispensary, an ATM, and a cultural hub named Kalamandir.

text_for_ai: RLJIT's Incubation Center supports startups like Big Line Infotech. The institute actively participates in the Unnat Bharat Abhiyan and has an Institution's Innovation Council (IIC).

title: Key Events & Calendar

details.silver_jubilee: Celebrated 25 years & Founder's Birth Centenary on Oct 18-19

text_for_ai: Major events include the Silver Jubilee celebration, the upcoming Cybersecurity FDP in July 2025, and Hackathon 2025 scheduled for September.

text_for_ai: Student life includes the NSS, Youth Red Cross, and BIS Standards Club. The institute enforces strict anti-ragging policies to ensure a safe environment.

title: General Information & Trust

details.vision: To be a premier institution by imparting Quality in Technical Education, Professional Training and Research
details.trust_institutions: SDU Medical College, SDU Nursing College, RLJIT, RLJ Polytechnic, SDU International Residential School
details.iqac: Internal Quality Assurance Cell established with defined Quality Policy

text_for_ai: RLJIT is sponsored by the Sri Devaraj Urs Educational Trust (SDUET). Its vision is to be a premier institution in technical education. It is NAAC accredited and maintains an Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC).

details.key_policies: Academic Policy, R&D Policy, Anti-Ragging, Grievance Redressal, Internal Complaint Committee (ICC)

text_for_ai: RLJIT maintains strict policies including Anti-Ragging, R&D, and Grievance Redressal. Mandatory disclosures and audit reports are publicly available.

title: R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (RLJIT) - Overview

details.location: Kodigehalli, Doddaballapur – 561203, Bengaluru Rural District, Karnataka, India

text_for_ai: R. L. Jalappa Institute of Technology (RLJIT) was established in 2001 in Doddaballapur, Karnataka. It is affiliated with VTU, approved by AICTE, and managed by the Sri Devaraj Urs Educational Trust.

title: Academic Programs & Performance

details.ug_programs: CSE, ECE, Mechanical, CSE (Data Science), CSE (AI & ML)
details.curriculum: Follows VTU curriculum with added value courses (NPTEL/MOOC/Coursera)

text_for_ai: RLJIT offers 5 UG courses including emerging areas like AI&ML and Data Science, and 1 PG course (MBA).  The institute maintains a high pass percentage of 96.81% and integrates MOOCs into student learning.

title: Faculty Profile & Quality
text_for_ai: The institute has a student-teacher ratio of 12.75:1 with around 73 full-time faculty members. Approximately 25 faculty members hold Ph.D. degrees, and 10 are recognized research supervisors.

title: Campus Infrastructure & Learning Resources

details.internet: Wi-Fi enabled campus with 310 Mbps bandwidth
details.library: 25,000 volumes, 3,200 Titles, 7,794 e-journals, Automated with Libsoft 12.0
details.sports: Cricket ground, Football field, Basketball court, Gym (Men & Women)
details.hostels: Separate hostels for Boys and Girls
details.other_facilities: Staff quarters (80 houses), Dispensary, ATM, Solar rooftop plant

text_for_ai: RLJIT features a 30-acre campus with 310 Mbps Wi-Fi, a library with 25,000 volumes, and extensive sports facilities.It provides residential quarters for staff and hostels for students, along with green energy initiatives like solar power.

title: Research, Innovation & Extension
text_for_ai: The institute fosters research through 3 recognized centers, an Incubation Centre with startups, and 35 industrial MoUs.Faculty have published over 112 papers and secured 11 patents.

title: Student Support & Progression

details.social_activities: NSS, Youth Red Cross, Lions Club (200+ activities)

text_for_ai: RLJIT supports students through the Local Guardian mentoring scheme and scholarships benefiting over 70% of students. It has a placement rate of over 65% and a strong alumni network of 5000+ members.

title: Institutional Values & Best Practices

details.gender_equity: 36% female faculty, 47% female students, Women Empowerment Cell
details.green_initiatives: Solar power, Rainwater harvesting, Sewage treatment plant, LED lighting
details.social_responsibility: Unnat Bharat Abhiyan (5 villages adopted), Blood donation camps
details.best_practices: Innovative Teaching & Learning Methods, Local Guardian (LG) Scheme

text_for_ai: The institute promotes gender equity with significant female representation and active women's cells. Best practices include the Local Guardian mentoring scheme and community engagement through the adoption of 5 villages.

title: Student Enrollment & Diversity
text_for_ai: In the academic year 2022-23, RLJIT admitted 315 students, bringing the total strength to 931. The institute has a healthy gender ratio with approximately 47% female students and has filled 82.45% of its reserved category seats.

title: Examination Results (Final Year)

details.university_ranks: Mechanical Engineering Dept secured 4th Rank in VTU

text_for_ai: RLJIT consistently demonstrates strong academic performance with a 5-year average pass percentage of 96.81%. In 2021-22, the pass percentage reached an impressive 99.26%.

title: Placement & Progression Statistics
text_for_ai: The institute has maintained an average placement and progression rate of 67.02% over the last five years. In the 2021-22 academic year, 217 students were successfully placed or moved to higher education.

title: Teacher Qualifications & Profile
text_for_ai: As of 2022-23, RLJIT employs 73 full-time teachers, 25 of whom hold Ph.D. degrees. The institute supports faculty development, with 59 teachers receiving financial aid for conferences in the last year.

title: Infrastructure & Maintenance Expenditure
text_for_ai: In 2022-23, the institute invested significantly in growth, spending 138.22 Lakhs on infrastructure augmentation and 152.65 Lakhs on maintenance. The annual library expenditure for books and journals was over 6 Lakhs.

title: Research Output & Grants
text_for_ai: Research activity is robust with 15 Lakhs in grants received in 2022-23 and 35 papers published in UGC journals. The faculty have also published 11 patents and conducted 23 research-related workshops recently.

title: Community & Social Outreach

details.key_programs: Blood Donation, Tree Plantation, Women's Health Awareness, Solar Lamp Assembly

text_for_ai: RLJIT is deeply connected to the community through the Unnat Bharat Abhiyan, adopting 5 villages. They have conducted 44 extension activities including health camps and environmental drives, earning over 45 awards.

title: Digital Assets & Network Capabilities

details.network_topology: Star Topology with 20 Port Switches and 72 Dual Band Access Points

text_for_ai: RLJIT maintains a robust IT infrastructure with 510 computers and a high-speed internet connection of 310 Mbps. The network utilizes a Star topology, and the institute employs specialized software like Drillbit for plagiarism checking and Libsoft for library management.

title: Leadership, Policies & Staff Welfare

details.governance_structure: Decentralized system with Governing Council, Institute Council, and IQAC
details.e_governance_areas: Administration, Finance & Accounts, Student Admission & Support, Examination
details.staff_welfare: EPF, Gratuity, Group Insurance, 25-40% Fee concession for wards, 50-100% Medical concession
details.performance_appraisal: Annual self-appraisal evaluated by HOD and Principal based on results, feedback, and research

text_for_ai: The institute operates under a decentralized governance structure including a Governing Council and IQAC. Staff welfare measures are comprehensive, offering EPF, insurance, and significant fee concessions for employees' children and medical treatments.

title: Institutional Distinctiveness & Focus

details.primary_focus: Serving rural and economically backward students (approx. 75% of intake)
details.community_arm: Lions Club of Doddaballapura RL Jalappa Institutions
details.unique_approach: Holistic development through 'Learning by Doing' and industry-specific training
details.health_services: Mega annual health camps and subsidized treatment at Sri R L Jalappa Hospital

text_for_ai: A key distinctive feature of RLJIT is its commitment to rural education, with 75% of students coming from rural backgrounds. The institute integrates community service through its own Lions Club and provides subsidized healthcare to staff and students.

title: Key Institutional Best Practices

details.practice_1_details: Use of ICT tools, Flipped classes, Role play, and Project-based learning to enhance engagement
details.practice_2_details: Mentoring ratio of 1:20; weekly counseling meetings to monitor academic and personal progress
details.outcome: Reduced failure rates and dropouts; improved student behavior and parent satisfaction

text_for_ai: RLJIT implements the 'Local Guardian Scheme,' assigning one faculty mentor to every 20 students to monitor progress and reduce dropouts. Additionally, it employs innovative teaching methods like project-based learning and ICT integration to improve student outcomes.

title: IQAC & Feedback Mechanisms

details.audit_process: Regular Academic and Administrative Audits (AAA) by internal and external teams
details.feedback_action: Analysis used for curriculum enrichment and faculty appraisal

text_for_ai: The Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC), established in 2021, drives quality through regular Academic and Administrative Audits. Feedback is actively collected from all stakeholders to refine the curriculum and administrative processes.

title: Green Campus & Sustainability Initiatives

details.energy_sources: Solar rooftop plant installed at ECE block, LED lights used
details.water_conservation: Rainwater harvesting facilities and sewage water treatment plant
details.audits: Regular Green Audit, Energy Audit, and Environmental Audit undertaken
details.waste_management: Management of degradable and non-degradable waste implemented
details.landscaping: Campus maintained with full greenery and 5000+ trees

text_for_ai: RLJIT promotes sustainability through solar rooftop plants, rainwater harvesting, and sewage treatment plants. The campus conducts regular Green and Energy audits and maintains a lush environment with over 5000 trees.

title: Professional Development & Welfare Schemes

details.fdp_participation: 62.98% of staff participated in FDPs/Administrative training
details.financial_support: 55% of teachers provided financial support for conferences/memberships
details.welfare_benefits: EPF, Gratuity, Group Insurance, Maternity Leave (6 months), Earned/Casual Leave
details.concessions: 25-40% fee concession for wards; free local transport and dispensary facility

text_for_ai: The institute supports faculty growth, with 62.98% participating in FDPs and 55% receiving financial aid for conferences. Welfare measures include EPF, Group Insurance, maternity leave, and fee concessions for employees' children.

title: Alumni Association & Engagement

details.key_events: Global Alumni Meet held annually on December 25th
details.contributions: Scholarships, RO Drinking water plant donation, mock interviews, and career guidance
details.entrepreneurship: Alumni entrepreneurs mentor students on starting new ventures

text_for_ai: Registered in 2010, the Alumni Association connects over 5000 members and holds a Global Alumni Meet every December 25th. Alumni actively contribute through scholarships, infrastructure donations, and student mentorship.

title: Cultural & Sports Achievements

details.cultural_fest: 'Santhasa' - Mega annual cultural fest with 2000+ gathering
details.ethnic_day: Celebrated annually to revive respect for culture and history
details.sports_awards: 42 awards/medals for outstanding performance in last 5 years
details.participation: Average of 36 sports/cultural programs participated in annually

text_for_ai: Student life is vibrant with 'Santhasa', a mega cultural fest attracting over 2000 people, and an annual Ethnic Day. Students have won 42 awards in sports and cultural activities over the last five years.

title: Examination & Assessment System

details.weightage: Varies by scheme (e.g., 2022 scheme: 25 marks CIE + 25 marks Assignment)
details.grievance_redressal: Complaints addressed by HoD within 3 days
details.transparency: Bluebooks shown to students; revaluation and photocopy options available

text_for_ai: The evaluation system includes three Continuous Internal Evaluation (CIE) tests and assignments. The process is transparent, allowing students to view evaluated booklets, with grievances resolved within three days.

title: National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 Initiatives

details.multidisciplinary_approach: Curriculum integrates open electives, SEC, and AEC; focuses on holistic development
details.academic_bank_of_credits_abc: Students registered with ABC and IDs generated for credit transfer
details.skill_development: Tie-up with ATOMS training partner; vocational education emphasized
details.indian_knowledge_system_iks: Mandatory credit courses in 'Samskrutika/Balake Kannada'; translation activities encouraged
details.outcome_based_education: Strict adherence to NBA/NAAC norms with defined POs, COs, and PSOs
details.online_education: Usage of SWAYAM, NPTEL, and VMEDULIFE LMS platform

text_for_ai: RLJIT has actively implemented NEP 2020 by registering students for the Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) and integrating the Indian Knowledge System through mandatory Kannada courses. The curriculum emphasizes multidisciplinary learning and skill development through partnerships like ATOMS.

title: Electoral Literacy Club (ELC) & Initiatives

details.establishment: Established in 2018, chaired by the Principal
details.objectives: Sensitizing students on democratic rights and voting
details.activities: Voter registration drives, awareness campaigns, poster competitions
details.community_support: Assisting senior citizens and disabled persons during elections
details.survey: Institution-level survey conducted to evaluate electoral awareness

text_for_ai: The Electoral Literacy Club (ELC), established in 2018, actively engages students in voter registration and awareness campaigns. Chaired by the Principal, the club also assists the community, including disabled voters, during elections.

title: Gender Sensitization & Women's Safety

details.safety_measures: 212 CCTV cameras, security staff, ID card enforcement
details.facilities: Separate common rooms for ladies and gents, napkin vending machines
details.welfare: 6 months maternity leave, special leave during menstrual period

text_for_ai: RLJIT promotes gender equity with a strong female presence (47% students) and specific welfare measures like 6 months of maternity leave. Safety is prioritized with 212 CCTV cameras and dedicated common rooms.

title: Library Collections & Specialized Services

details.daily_usage: Average of 407 faculty and students visit per day

text_for_ai: The library offers specialized resources, including a Book Bank with over 2,800 books for SC/ST students and a collection of rare encyclopedias. It sees high engagement with an average of 407 daily visitors and features a fully equipped digital library.

title: Stakeholder Feedback System

details.mechanism: 360-degree feedback collected from students, teachers, employers, and alumni

title: Course Outcomes (CO) & Program Outcomes (PO)

details.communication_channels: Website, Department Offices, Laboratories, Classrooms, Lab Manuals, Attendance Registers
details.definitions: COs describe essential disciplinary knowledge; POs describe professional accomplishments

text_for_ai: RLJIT strictly follows Outcome-Based Education (OBE). Course Outcomes (COs) and Program Outcomes (POs) are widely displayed across campus, including in classrooms, labs, and attendance registers. Attainment is calculated using 90% direct assessment and 10% indirect assessment.

title: Maintenance & Upkeep Policy

details.schedule: Major works during semester vacations; minor works as needed
details.scope: Includes buildings, classrooms, seminar halls, laboratories, and campus greenery

text_for_ai: The institute has a dedicated maintenance team led by an Assistant Executive Engineer. In the 2022-23 academic year, 152.65 Lakhs was spent on maintaining physical and academic support facilities. Major maintenance works are scheduled during semester vacations.

title: Innovation Ecosystem & Startups

details.funding_sources: Grants received from VGST, KSCST, VTU, and ANVESHANA
details.research_output: 112 research papers published in reputed journals

text_for_ai: RLJIT established its Business Incubator (RLJBI) in 2023 and currently supports 4 start-ups. The innovation ecosystem has produced 11 published patents and secured funding from agencies like VGST and KSCST.

title: Advanced Teaching Methodologies

details.methods: Experiential learning, Project-based learning, Role play, Flipped classes

title: Scholarship Trends (5 Years)

details.policy: Well-established Scholarship Monitoring System for government and non-government grants

title: Empowerment of Rural Students

title: Institutional Strengths (SWOC)

title: Weaknesses & Challenges (SWOC)

details.weaknesses: Lack of autonomy; fewer University ranks; limited DST sponsored projects
details.challenges: Improving communication skills of rural students; competition from private universities
details.nep_challenge: Complete implementation of NEP-2020 in the present scenario
details.entrepreneurship: Need to encourage more entrepreneurs in core sectors

text_for_ai: The institute identifies challenges such as the need for greater autonomy, increasing the number of university ranks, and improving the communication skills of its predominantly rural student base. It also faces competition from deemed and private universities.

title: Conclusion & Strategic Vision

details.core_philosophy: 'Learning by Doing' and 'Learning to Learn themselves'
details.future_goal: To become an education, research, and consultancy hub

text_for_ai: RLJIT aims to evolve into a central hub for education, research, and consultancy. The institute's philosophy centers on 'Learning by Doing,' blending Outcome Based Education with project-based learning to foster an agile culture of continuous improvement.

title: Curriculum - First Year - Semester 1 (Physics Cycle)

details.Subjects: Mathematics-I, Applied Physics, Principles of Programming in C, Basic Electronics, Elements of Civil Engineering.
details.Labs: Engineering Physics Lab, C Programming Lab.
details.Common: Innovation and Design Thinking (IDT), Communicative English.

text_for_ai: In the Physics Cycle of the First Year (Semester 1), students study Mathematics-I, Applied Physics, C Programming, Basic Electronics, and Civil Engineering. It includes labs for Physics and C Programming.

title: Curriculum - First Year - Semester 1 (Chemistry Cycle)

details.Subjects: Mathematics-I, Applied Chemistry, Problem Solving with Python, Basic Electrical Engineering, Elements of Mechanical Engineering.
details.Labs: Engineering Chemistry Lab, Python Programming Lab.
details.Common: Innovation and Design Thinking (IDT), Communicative English.

text_for_ai: In the Chemistry Cycle of the First Year (Semester 1), students focus on Mathematics-I, Applied Chemistry, Python Programming, Basic Electrical Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering. It includes labs for Chemistry and Python.

title: Curriculum - First Year - Semester 2

details.Overview: Students swap cycles (Physics to Chemistry or vice versa).

text_for_ai: In Semester 2, students swap their cycle (Physics students take Chemistry subjects, and vice versa). Mathematics-II is the common core subject, along with Professional Writing Skills in English.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 3

details.Core Subjects: Transform Calculus, Fourier Series & Numerical Tech, Data Structures & Applications, Analog & Digital Electronics, Computer Organization & Architecture.
details.Labs: Object Oriented Programming with Java, Data Structures Lab.

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 3 covers Data Structures, Computer Organization, and Java Programming. It also includes Transform Calculus and Digital Electronics.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 4

details.Core Subjects: Math Foundations/Linear Algebra, Design & Analysis of Algorithms, Microcontroller & Embedded Systems, Operating Systems, Biology for Engineers.
details.Languages/Common: Samskrutika/Balake Kannada, Constitution of India, Universal Human Values.

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 4 focuses on Algorithms, Operating Systems, and Embedded Systems. It includes mathematical foundations and Python labs.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 5

details.Core Subjects: Automata Theory & Compiler Design, Computer Networks, Database Management Systems (DBMS), Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning.
details.Labs: DBMS Lab with Mini Project, AngularJS/NodeJS (Skill Lab).

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 5 introduces advanced topics like AI, Machine Learning, DBMS, and Compiler Design. It also includes full-stack skills like AngularJS and NodeJS.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 6

details.Core Subjects: Software Engineering & Project Management, Full Stack Development, Computer Graphics & Image Processing.
details.Electives: Advanced Java, Data Mining, or Cloud Computing.

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 6 covers Software Engineering, Full Stack Development, and Computer Graphics. Students also undertake a Mini Project.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 7

details.Core Subjects: Big Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, Object Oriented Modeling & Design.

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 7 focuses on Big Data and Cloud Computing. Students begin Phase 1 of their Major Project.

title: Curriculum - CSE - Semester 8

details.Activities: Technical Seminar, Research/Industry Internship, Major Project Work (Phase 2), Online Course (MOOCs).

text_for_ai: CSE Semester 8 is dedicated to the final Major Project, Internships, and Technical Seminars.

title: Curriculum - ECE - Semester 3

details.Core Subjects: Transform Calculus & Numerical Techniques, Digital System Design using Verilog, Basic Signal Processing, Analog Electronic Circuits.
details.Labs: Analog & Digital Electronics Lab, LabVIEW Programming.

text_for_ai: ECE Semester 3 introduces Digital System Design (Verilog), Signal Processing, and Analog Circuits.

title: Curriculum - ECE - Semester 4

details.Core Subjects: Maths for Communication Engineers, Digital Signal Processing (DSP), Circuits & Controls, Communication Theory, Biology for Engineers.

text_for_ai: ECE Semester 4 focuses on Digital Signal Processing (DSP), Communication Theory, and Control Systems.

title: Curriculum - ECE - Semester 5

details.Core Subjects: Digital Communication, Computer Organization & ARM Microcontrollers, Electromagnetic Waves, Computer Communication Networks.

title: Curriculum - ECE - Semester 7

details.Core Subjects: Wireless Communication, Digital Image Processing, Information Theory & Coding.

title: Curriculum - ECE - Semester 8

details.Activities: Technical Seminar, Internship, Major Project Work (Phase 2), Online Course (MOOCs).

text_for_ai: ECE Semester 8 involves the completion of the Major Project, Internships, and Technical Seminars.

details.Core Subjects: Calculus, Metal Casting, Forming & Joining Processes, Material Science & Engineering, Thermodynamics.

text_for_ai: First Semester AI&ML (Section F, Chemistry Cycle) for 2025-26 is coordinated by Mrs. Reshma SR in room CS-304. Subjects include Calculus, Applied Chemistry, Python Programming, and Introduction to AI. Monday mornings include Placement sessions.

text_for_ai: The 7th Semester Data Science (Section A) timetable for 2025-26 is coordinated by Mrs. Ramya N. Key subjects include Parallel Programming, SML, and Cryptography. Major Project Phase-II is scheduled on Wednesdays and Fridays.

text_for_ai: Semester 7 AI&ML (Section A) for 2025-26 is coordinated by Mrs. Anupriya A G in room 301. Curriculum focuses on Deep Learning, Machine Learning II, and Cryptography. Saturdays are reserved for major project reviews.
